reviewText: This film is absolutely fantastic and one you'll want to watch again and again. I loved everything about it and learned so much. I almost felt as if I was right there with the group who had gathered at a lovely country home to spend a few days experiencing EFT. Each one came with their own set of challenges and each one left at the end of the stay renewed and relieved from their individual problems.I feel that this EFT video needs to be seen by people in every walk of life because it's something that anyone can find a need for. It is well named, (Try It On Everything) because you can literally use EFT on everything! I'm certain that in time it will indeed be a method of healing emotions and sickness that is accepted universally by everyone.The film was extremely well done and very professional....I loved the background music and the whole setting of the project. I really found myself feeling so calm and peaceful just watching several of the EFT sessions. I even felt as if I too could handle the snake without the slightest qualms. Of course it helped by tapping along with the others, and I guess that's why I felt as if I were part of the group.If you are the slightest bit doubtful about whether to purchase this dvd, please don't hesitate to get a copy, it is so well done and a credit to the whole EFT movement, I promise you won't be disappointed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I had been dabbling with EFT (tapping) for a couple ofyears when this DVD was recommended on a tapping website. It sounded really interesting to see people being taught and using EFT to work on their problems, so I ordered it. Then in my usual fashion, I put off watching it for a week (fear?)!Finally I made myself sit down and watch it. From the first question they asked the clients to answer, to the last minute of the reunion shots, I was so moved. I related to so many of the problems and feelings in the video, and the video gave me much hope that they could be addressed outside the "conventional" medicine world (which I try to avoid except in dire emergencies).I would highly recommend to anyone wishing to improve their life, whether it is dealing with problems, improving attractiveness to others, overcoming performance anxiety, etc., don't miss this video! It is well done and the comments of the presenters (Jack Canfield, Dr, Mercola, etc.) as well as all of the actual events work together to make a moving and life changing video.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: Kaye L for love "Dare to achieve"
reviewText: I watched the DVD, "Try it on Everything" again.  Only last night I did the exercises.  I became aware of a casual, but hurtful comment that my mother made when I was approximately four years old and how it drove my life.  I was looking for a relief from pain and help with my weight when I did the exercise, but instead I've been given back my life.  One of the speakers mentioned how this happens, a comment by a parent and the rest of our lives we make decisions from the intellect of a kindergartener.  I cried like I've never cried before and had the opportunity to forgive my mother as she didn't realize what she was doing.  Children see the world from a different prospective than an adult.  It answers the question, why do we feel that we're never good enough.  It's very painful to go back to childhood, but well worth the effort.  We can find out why we're attracting the pain, the struggle and the problems into our lives.I feel strongly that every parent should see this and to realize how fragile children are as well as how open (without protection) they are.  The concept works.  Everyone can learn from this video.  I so appreciate the people who put it out, and the marvelous stars.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have read dozens of books on EFT, in the hopes of learning to do the process so I can stop procrastinating, dissolve my fears and move forward into all the wonderful things I want to do in life.  The diagrams just were not doing it for me.  I read through all the DVD descriptions and reviews and chose this one and the companion book.  The DVD is professionally produced - the picture is sharp and the music is peaceful.  The DVD moves between actual sessions with people tapping to overcome their fears and release the past; and experts explaining in plain simple language how we can gently move on with our lives and release the past.This mixing of the two elements - experts talking and everyday people tapping and moving through heartache we all suffer is what makes this DVD emotionally satisfying. The sequence for tapping, how much pressure to apply when you tap, what to say as you move through the sequence - even how to take one issue at a time to work through are all explained here in this one DVD.I am now reading the book and tapping every day, slowly reducing daily stress and moving forward with my life. If you want to try something that requires only your willingness to tap your fingers and work through what emotions come up (so you can accept them and release the past for good), try this DVD and the companion book.  You will be glad you did.
summary: Great explanation and introduction to EFT
Title: N/A

reviewText: I've been doing EFT for several years and, in my initial enthusiasm, I sent DVD's of Gary Craig's instructions to several people and sent the link to his website where he offers the directions free of charge.  One person was able to make use of the DVD's but she had ongoing personal sessions with me, anyway.  The others just couldn't get into the tapes.  One let them sit on her bedroom floor forever until I finally asked her to return them.  Another watched them but never started doing EFT.  Another looked at the free manual but it was too much for her to do. She's very intelligent, too.So, I was really happy to see this DVD which is a very friendly, non-technical introduction to EFT.  It does give directions for how to do it for the beginner but mostly it shows how it affects the lives of ten people with varying problems.  It shows some of their tapping sessions but doesn't intrude too much into them, respecting their privacy.  Actutally some people feel that it doesn't show enough of the actual tapping sessions.  I would refer those folks to Gary's very complete DVD's or to some of the many books that are now available on the subject.This is just a really nice, human, introduction to the process.  And it does give enough information on how to do it so that a lot of people can benefit just from this DVD alone.(In no way do I mean to disparage Gary Craig's wonderful work and very useful DVD's.  I think that he has done the world a great service by devising this process, which is a refinement of what he learned from Roger Callahan.  And the fact that Gary has made, and still makes, the manual available at no cost on his website, is something else for which we should all be grateful.)  There is a place for all of these great tools and people can choose among them to find what works best for them.The friend who left Gary's DVD's on her bedroom floor did actually watch this DVD and has just had a very beneficial tapping session.  She is ordering the DVD and the book for herself and plans to use it for herself and to offer to her clients.
summary: A very friendly introduction to EFT
Title: N/A
